org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.channels

Class InputChannel<T extends IOReadableWritable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.channels.Channel
      • org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.channels.InputChannel<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Type of the record that can be transported through the channel.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferProvider

    public class InputChannel<T extends IOReadableWritable>
extends Channel
implements BufferProvider
    InputChannel is an abstract base class to all different kinds of concrete input channels that can be used. Input channels are always parameterized to a specific type that can be transported through the channel.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.bufferprovider.BufferProvider

        Parameters:
        inputGate - the input gate this channel is connected to
        channelIndex - the index of the channel in the input gate
        channelID - the ID of the channel
        connectedChannelID - the ID of the channel this channel is connected to

      • requestBuffer

        public Buffer requestBuffer(int minBufferSize)
                     throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: BufferProvider
        Requests a buffer with a minimum size of minBufferSize. The method returns immediately, even if the request could not be fulfilled.
        Specified by:
        requestBuffer in interface BufferProvider
        Parameters:
        minBufferSize - minimum size of the requested buffer (in bytes)
        Returns:
        buffer with at least the requested size or null if no such buffer is currently available
        Throws:
        IOException

      • requestBufferBlocking

        public Buffer requestBufferBlocking(int minBufferSize)
                             throws IOException,
                                    InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: BufferProvider
        Requests a buffer with a minimum size of minBufferSize. The method blocks until the request has been fulfilled or BufferProvider.reportAsynchronousEvent() has been called.
        Specified by:
        requestBufferBlocking in interface BufferProvider
        Parameters:
        minBufferSize - minimum size of the requested buffer (in bytes)
        Returns:
        buffer with at least the requested size
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException

      • reportAsynchronousEvent

        public void reportAsynchronousEvent()
        Description copied from interface: BufferProvider
        Reports an asynchronous event and interrupts each blocking method of this buffer provider in order to allow the blocked thread to respond to the event.
        Specified by:
        reportAsynchronousEvent in interface BufferProvider

      • registerBufferAvailabilityListener

        public BufferProvider.BufferAvailabilityRegistration registerBufferAvailabilityListener(BufferAvailabilityListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: BufferProvider
        Registers the given BufferAvailabilityListener with an empty buffer pool.

        The registration only succeeds, if the buffer pool is empty and has not been destroyed yet.

        The registered listener will receive a notification when at least one buffer has become available again. After the notification, the listener will be unregistered.

        Specified by:
        registerBufferAvailabilityListener in interface BufferProvider
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be registered
        Returns:
        true if the registration has been successful; false if the registration failed, because the buffer pool was not empty or has already been destroyed
